title: (x) " Summer of Love: Art of the Psychedelic Era" Tate Liverpool 2005 - custom font (A2 London) {James Langdon}
content:
Can you please help me identify this joyous face.

thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905210237im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/SOL-Type-Detail_5237.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Robert Plant "Nine Lives" - Onyx, Bickham Script {BJ Harvey, Rockberto (self)}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905210237/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39986 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Slab serif typeface on classic Marlboro ads - Neo Contact {Dan R} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905210237/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39990 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jondj24

comments.content:
This looks intriguing … a typewriter face with small caps, osf, true italics, ligatures and superscripts – should be well-known.  
 [FF Elementa](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905210237/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-elementa/) comes to my mind, and, because of the briskness, [MVB Fantabular](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905210237/http:/mvbfonts.com/html/fonts/fantabsans/pk_fantabsans.htm); but they both are way off.  
I’m curious about it.
That’s not a typewriter face any more than American Typewriter is.

This is a custom typeface by A2 in London

[http://www.a2swhk.co.uk/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905210237/http:/www.a2swhk.co.uk/ "http://www.a2swhk.co.uk/")

They make type for a lot of their projects

its an upright italic elementa as mentioned by Florian  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff\_elementa\_bold\_italic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905210237/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_elementa_bold_italic/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff\_elementa\_bold\_italic/")

[WSDIA | WeShouldDoItAll](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905210237/http:/wsdia.com/)
I dunno. Looks like there’s a lot more to it than that. Lots of subtle differences. Perhaps they had similar source material.
